required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Safety and Efficacy of Intra-articular Ozone Injections for Knee Osteoarthritis
clinical_study.official_title: Safety and Efficacy of Intra-articular Ozone Injections for Knee Osteoarthritis

brief_summary.textblock: Prospective, Interventional, Non-Randomized, Open Label, Single Group Assignment, Single Center.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: A sequential series of patients receiving steroid injections was compared to a sequential series of patients receiving ozone injections
study_design_info.masking_description: the outcome assessor was not aware of the therapy administered

primary_outcome.description: The outcome measure will be measured according to patient response to the question: during the last week what was your average pain intensity. The response will be measured in millimeters as marked on a 10 cm long line. No pain equals 0 mm and maximal possible pain equals 100mm

intervention.description: Injection of ozone gas intra articularly

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- 55 to 79 years of age
- Symptomatic Knee osteoarthritis
- VAS pain intensity is at least 40 mm on a 100 mm scale
- Must be physically and mentally willing and able to comply with post-operative rehabilitation and routinely schedule clinical and radiographic visits.
Exclusion Criteria:
- Any known tumor of the ipsilateral knee.
- Any known infection of the treated knee.
- Osteoarthritis of the operated knee Kelgren Lawrence < grade 2.
- Chemotherapy treatment in the past 12 months.
- Patients who are sensitive to ozone.
- Pregnant women, or breastfeeding women.
- Evidence of any significant systemic disease (such as but not limited to HIV infection, hepatitis infection or HTLV infection), known coagulopathies, that might compromise the Subject's welfare.
- Substance abuse or alcohol abuse.
- Participation in other clinical trials in parallel to this study.
